what: Tools of Utilization and Cost in Healthcare
title: Tools of Utilization and Cost in Healthcare
text: package touch (Tools unilization cost healthcare) provides R implementation software tools developed H-CUP (Healthcare Cost Utilization Project) AHRQ (Agency Healthcare Research Quality). currently contains functions mapping ICD-9 codes AHRQ comorbidity measures translating ICD-9 (resp. ICD-10) codes ICD-10 (resp. ICD-9) codes based GEM (General Equivalence Mappings) CMS (Centers Medicare Medicaid Services).

title: Tools of Utilization and Cost in Healthcare
text: may install released version CRAN.

title: Tools of Utilization and Cost in Healthcare
text: One may install latest version development follows:

title: Tools of Utilization and Cost in Healthcare

what: Comorbidity measures from AHRQ HCUP — cmbd
title: Comorbidity measures from AHRQ HCUP — cmbd
text: function maps matrix ICD9 codes AHRQ comorbidity measures.

title: Comorbidity measures from AHRQ HCUP — cmbd
code: cmbd(icd, drg = NULL, needClean = TRUE, needPrep = TRUE)

title: Comorbidity measures from AHRQ HCUP — cmbd
text: icd character matrix icd9 codes, rows representing patients. drg numeric vector drg codes, length nrow(icd). needClean logical, TRUE means cleaning needed (string trimming, zero supplementation) needPrep logical, TRUE means preparation needed (convert char numeric)

title: Comorbidity measures from AHRQ HCUP — cmbd
text: matrix number rows input comorbidity measures columns

title: Comorbidity measures from AHRQ HCUP — cmbd
text: Elixhauser et. al. (1998)

title: Comorbidity measures from AHRQ HCUP — cmbd
text: Jun Yan

title: Comorbidity measures from AHRQ HCUP — cmbd
code: data(dxDat) drg <- dxDat$drg icd <- dxDat[, -1L] output <- cmbd(icd, drg=drg)

what: Sample Data of Diagnosis Code — dxDat
title: Sample Data of Diagnosis Code — dxDat
text: data frame diagnosis code variates named drg dx1, dx2, ..., dx10, drg: drg code comorbidity; dx1-dx10: icd-9 code 10 diagnosises.

title: Sample Data of Diagnosis Code — dxDat
Sample Data of Diagnosis Code — dxDat
text: data frame 1000 rows 11 variables.

title: Sample Data of Diagnosis Code — dxDat

what: Find Billable ICD Codes from CMS GEMs — find_billable
title: Find Billable ICD Codes from CMS GEMs — find_billable
text: function tries find billable ICD codes can translated CMS GEMs input diagnosis codes representing major category.

title: Find Billable ICD Codes from CMS GEMs — find_billable
code: find_billable(dx, version = 10, year = 2018,               match_all = TRUE, decimal = FALSE,               output = c("character", "list", "tidy-data"), ...)

title: Find Billable ICD Codes from CMS GEMs — find_billable
text: dx character vector representing diagnosis codes.  element vector can either represent individual diagnosis code set diagnosis codes concartenated commas . version numeric value specifying version diagnosis codes either 9 ICD-9 codes 10 ICD-10 codes. year numeric value specifying year CMS GEMs.  currently available options 2017 2018.  default, 2018 CMS GEMs used. match_all logical value specifying strategy finding billable codes based input diagnosis category.  TRUE (default), function add regular expression "[[[[:alnum:]]{1,4}]]" tail diagnosis category billable diagnosis codes given category matched.  FALSE, function add regular experssion "[[:alnum:]]" repeatedly four times set billable codes matched. decimal logical value.  TRUE, diagnosis codes returned decimal points.  default FALSE. output character value specifying format output.  avaiable options "character", "list", "tidy-data".  default, option "character" used results character vector consists element-wise concatenatation commas translated diagnosis codes original codes.  "list" specified, translated codes concartenated list character vectors returned function.  Similarly, "tidy-data" specified, data frame tidy format returned.  first column data frame consists original diagnosis codes; second column consists translated diagnosis codes. ... arguments future usage.  warning thrown argument goes ... accidentally.

title: Find Billable ICD Codes from CMS GEMs — find_billable
text: character vector length input vector     returned default output = "charactor".  list     character vectors returned output = "list"; data     frame tidy-format returned output = "tidy-data".     See argument output details.

title: Find Billable ICD Codes from CMS GEMs — find_billable
text: designed used function icd_map translating diagnosis codes billable representing major categories.  Notice character vector output can directly passed function icd_map translation.

title: Find Billable ICD Codes from CMS GEMs — find_billable
text: Wenjie Wang <wenjie.2.wang@uconn.edu>

title: Find Billable ICD Codes from CMS GEMs — find_billable
code: library(touch)  ### for ICD-9 codes icd9_major <- c("001", "316", "808", NA, "not_a_dx")  ## find all billable codes under the major category find_billable(icd9_major, version = 9) #> [1] "0010,0011,0019"                                                                            #> [2] "316"                                                                                       #> [3] "8080,8081,8082,8083,80841,80842,80843,80844,80849,80851,80852,80853,80854,80859,8088,8089" #> [4] NA                                                                                          #> [5] NA                                                                                           ## find the billable codes right under the major category (icd9_billable <- find_billable(icd9_major, version = 9,                                 match_all = FALSE)) #> [1] "0010,0011,0019"                "316"                           #> [3] "8080,8081,8082,8083,8088,8089" NA                              #> [5] NA                               ## compare the translation results icd_map(icd9_major, nomatch = NA) #> [1] NA    "F54" NA    NA    NA    icd_map(icd9_billable, nomatch = NA) #> [1] "A000,A001,A009"                                                                  #> [2] "F54"                                                                             #> [3] "S32409A,S32409B,S32501A,S32501B,S32502A,S32502B,S32509A,S32509B,S329XXA,S329XXB" #> [4] NA                                                                                #> [5] NA                                                                                 ### for ICD-10 codes icd10_major <- c("T36.0X2", "T36.3X2", "T38.6X2")  ## find all billable codes and output in different formats find_billable(icd10_major, version = 10) #> [1] "T360X2A,T360X2D,T360X2S" "T363X2A,T363X2D,T363X2S" #> [3] "T386X2A,T386X2D,T386X2S" find_billable(icd10_major, version = 10, output = "list") #> [[1]] #> [1] "T360X2A" "T360X2D" "T360X2S" #>  #> [[2]] #> [1] "T363X2A" "T363X2D" "T363X2S" #>  #> [[3]] #> [1] "T386X2A" "T386X2D" "T386X2S" #>  find_billable(icd10_major, version = 10, output = "tidy-data") #>   ICD-10 Billable_ICD-10 #> 1 T360X2         T360X2A #> 2 T360X2         T360X2D #> 3 T360X2         T360X2S #> 4 T363X2         T363X2A #> 5 T363X2         T363X2D #> 6 T363X2         T363X2S #> 7 T386X2         T386X2A #> 8 T386X2         T386X2D #> 9 T386X2         T386X2S  ## add decimal if wanted (icd10_billable <- find_billable(icd10_major, version = 10, decimal = TRUE)) #> [1] "T36.0X2A,T36.0X2D,T36.0X2S" "T36.3X2A,T36.3X2D,T36.3X2S" #> [3] "T38.6X2A,T38.6X2D,T38.6X2S"  ## compare the translation results icd_map(icd10_major, from = 10, to = 9, nomatch = NA) #> [1] NA NA NA icd_map(icd10_billable, from = 10, to = 9) #> [1] "9090+E959,9600+E9504,V5889" "9090+E959,9603+E9504,V5889" #> [3] "9090+E959,9621+E9504,V5889"

title: Reformat Comorbidity Measures — icd9Clean
text: function processes character matrix ICD9 codes converting character codes length 5.  SAS procedure HCUP, trims character string length 5, adds missing trailing white space, capitalizes first character ICD9 codes.

title: Reformat Comorbidity Measures — icd9Clean
Reformat Comorbidity Measures — icd9Clean
text: input character matrix ICD9 codes, rows representing patients. style character vector length one indicating reformatting style follow.  possible option "touch" "hcup". former cleaning package; latter reformatting SAS script provided HCUP.

title: Reformat Comorbidity Measures — icd9Clean
text: matrix cleaned ICD9 codes.

title: Reformat Comorbidity Measures — icd9Clean
text: Jun Yan Wenjie Wang

title: Reformat Comorbidity Measures — icd9Clean

what: Translatation of ICD Codes by General Equivalence Mappings (GEMs) — icd_map
title: Translatation of ICD Codes by General Equivalence Mappings (GEMs) — icd_map
text: open-source implementation R similar Mapping tool developed Agency Healthcare Research Quality (AHRQ).

title: Translatation of ICD Codes by General Equivalence Mappings (GEMs) — icd_map
code: icd_map(dx, from = 9, to = 10, year = 2018,         method = c("gem", "reverse-gem", "both", "multi-stage"),         decimal = FALSE, nomatch = c('""', NA),         output = c("character", "list", "tidy-data"), cache = TRUE, ...)

title: Translatation of ICD Codes by General Equivalence Mappings (GEMs) — icd_map
text: dx character vector representing diagnosis codes.  element vector can either represent individual diagnosis code set diagnosis codes concartenated commas . integer value specifying original code version. Currently, available options 9 10. integer value specifying original code version. Currently, available options 9 10.  input , function skip translation return input dx warning. year numeric value specifying year CMS GEMs.  currently available options 2017 2018.  default, 2018 CMS GEMs used. method character string specifying translateion method.  available options "gem" CMS GEM, "reverse-gem" reverse CMS GEM, "" GEM reverse GEM, "multi-stage" multiple stage procedure.  See Section Details detailed description procedure. decimal logical value.  TRUE, diagnosis codes returned decimal points.  default FALSE. nomatch character string indicating translation result can found specified mapping.  default, empty strings, "", used.  Another available option NA (specific NA_character_).  case, code translated NA_character_ translataion result can found. output character value specifying format output.  avaiable options "character", "list", "tidy-data".  default, option "character" used results character vector consists element-wise concatenatation commas translated diagnosis codes original codes.  "list" specified, translated codes concartenated list character vectors returned function.  Similarly, "tidy-data" specified, data frame tidy format returned.  first column data frame consists original diagnosis codes; second column consists translated diagnosis codes. cache logical value specifying whether cache mappings method = "" (CMS GEM reverse mapping), method = "multi-stage" (multiple stage procedure).  TRUE default, specified mapping generated, cached , applied translation.  FALSE, CMS GEM reverse mapping used translatation every time without cache.  recommended set cache = TRUE translation ICD-9 ICD-10.  translation ICD-10 ICD-9, caching process takes noticeable time (usually several minutes ) multi-stage procedure. ... arguments future usage.  warning thrown argument goes ... accidentally.

title: Translatation of ICD Codes by General Equivalence Mappings (GEMs) — icd_map
text: character vector length input vector     returned default output = "charactor".  list     character vectors returned output = "list"; data     frame tidy-format returned output = "tidy-data".     See argument output details.

title: Translatation of ICD Codes by General Equivalence Mappings (GEMs) — icd_map
text: function aims efficiently translates ICD diagnosis codes different version General Equivalence Mappings (GEMs) developed National Center Health Statistics, Centers Medicare Medicaid Services (CMS), AHIMA, American Hospital Association, 3M Health Information Systems.  CMS GEMs currently consist forward mapping ICD-9 codes ICD-10 codes backward mapping ICD-10 codes ICD-9 codes.  addition two mappings, Agency Healthcare Research Quality (AHRQ) also proposed translation using reverse mappings multi-stage procedure. Taking translation ICD-9 codes ICD-10 codes example, procedure elaborated follows: stage one, input ICD-9 codes mapped ICD-10 codes using ICD-9 ICD-10 forward map well reverse ICD-10 ICD-9 backward map.  multiStage = FALSE, procedure return translation results stage one (skip following stages).  Otherwise, procedure continue become multiple stage process.  stage two, ICD-10 codes output stage one mapped back ICD-9 codes using backward map well reverse forward map; stage three, applies forward map reverse-backward map used stage one ICD-9 codes stage two return resulting ICD-10 codes. flags GEMs exported function.  codes positive combination flags, combination converted ICD-10 codes indicated plus sign "+".  example, ICD-9 code "24951" can translated 2018 GEMs ICD-10 code, "E0839", "E0939", one codes ("E08311", "E08319", "E0836", "E09311" "E09319", "E0936") "E0865".  plus sign output, "E08311+E0865", used indicate combination "E08311" "E0865".

title: Translatation of ICD Codes by General Equivalence Mappings (GEMs) — icd_map
text: 2017-ICD-10-CM--GEMs.  U.S. Centers Medicare & Medicaid Services. 22 August, 2016. https://www.cms.gov/medicare/coding/icd10/2017-icd-10-cm--gems. Accessed 5 July, 2022. 2018-ICD-10-CM--GEMs.  U.S. Centers Medicare & Medicaid Services. 11 August, 2017. https://www.cms.gov/medicare/coding/icd10/2018-icd-10-cm--gems. Accessed 5 July, 2022. AHRQ MapIT Automated -house Stand-alone Mapping Tool. Agency Healthcare Research Quality. 26 March, 2018. https://qualityindicators.ahrq.gov/resources/toolkits. Accessed 5 July, 2022.
